intro: Uvaria sibuyanensis, commonly known as the Sibuyan starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically yellow or orange when mature. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
